name: Stone
description: A stone.

name: Sword of a Labraid Acolyte
description: A slender, curved blade forged from dark iron, etched with faintly glowing crimson runes. Sacred to Labraid's acolytes, this sword is passed down through generations, imbued with a trace of their god's dark power. It symbolizes their devotion and is used both in combat and in sacrificial rites to further Labraid's cause.

name: Valen’s Blade of Courage
description: A shining longsword etched with ancient runes, its surface polished to a mirror-like gleam. This sword was once wielded by Sir Valen, the Knight of Valor. Forged in the heart of a dying star, it was said to carry the courage of those who faced impossible odds. Sir Valen carried it into every battle, always leading from the front. Legend has it that the sword grows brighter with every act of bravery performed by its wielder.

name: Aetherian Coin
description: Ancient coins made of tarnished gold, bearing the face of a long-forgotten deity. These coins once held great value in the kingdoms that existed outside the Tower’s reach, though their currency has long been forgotten. Adventurers who enter the Tower often find them in the pockets of the fallen or in old treasure chests, relics of a world that the Tower devoured over the ages.

name: Yew Bow
description: A simple yet well-crafted bow made from sturdy yew wood, its surface worn smooth from frequent use. The limbs are carved with subtle, swirling designs that represent the Free Seekers’ belief in freedom and the natural flow of life.

name: Armour of the Lord Commander
description: The armour of Lord Commander Aldric Thorne, current leader of the Order of the four Knights. Lord Aldric Thorne rose to prominence through his fearless command in countless battles within the Tower, where his tactical brilliance and iron will earned him the title of Lord Commander. Under his leadership, the Order of the Four Knights remains one of the most powerful and disciplined factions within the Tower, feared by enemies and admired by allies.

name: White Shield of the Four Knights
description: A gleaming, round shield crafted from polished silversteel. Wielded by the elite members of the The Order of the Four Knights, this white shield is not just a defensive tool, but a symbol of their sacred duty to protect the Order and uphold their honor.

name: Spear of the Four Knights
description: A sleek, masterfully balanced spear with a narrow, leaf-like spearhead designed for both precision and power. Passed through generations, this spear embodies the honor and duty of those sworn to protect the Tower and uphold the laws of their order.

name: Beer Mug
description: Sturdy mug made from wood, their surfaces chipped and cracked. Its content is long gone. Even within the Tower, there were moments of respite, and these mugs represent that. Found in makeshift camps or hidden safe rooms, these mugs were used by adventurers to drink water, ale, or strange potions brewed from the Tower’s bizarre flora. They serve as relics of moments of brief peace, where weary travelers shared stories and planned their next move before once again braving the Tower’s dangers.

name: Blade of the Nameless
description: A curved blade that gleams with an otherworldly light. The origins of this blade are shrouded in mystery, though it is said to belong to warriors from a faraway land. Known only as the "Nameless," these warriors are rumored to appear when the Tower is in greatest peril, guided by ancient traditions long forgotten in this realm.

name: Garment of the High Priestess
description: The garment of High Priestess Elara Voss, the current leader of the cult of Labraid. Elara Voss is a powerful and enigmatic figure who commands both fear and reverence within the Cult of Labraid. Known for her eloquence and commanding presence, she navigates the complex web of politics and power within the Tower with great skill. Her followers view her as the living embodiment of Labraid's will, as she leads the cult in their pursuit of forbidden knowledge and the control of the Tower's hidden realms.

name: Compass of the Free Seekers
description: A well-worn, brass compass, its needle twitching erratically as though pulled by unseen forces. This compass once belonged to a prominent member of the Free Seekers, and while it may seem broken, it embodies their chaotic yet deeply interconnected organization. Unlike other factions that rely on rigid hierarchies, the Free Seekers value independence, exploration, and intuition above all else. To the Free Seekers, the compass is more than a tool; it’s a metaphor for their entire organization: fractured yet resourceful, wandering yet always finding their way.

name: Greystone’s Shield of Unyielding Honor
description: A massive, imposing black shield, polished to an obsidian-like sheen. Two intricately carved golden dragons coil around its face. This shield was once carried by Sir Greystone, the Knight of Honor. Known for his unwavering commitment to justice and duty, Sir Greystone’s shield became a symbol of his unbreakable will and unyielding honor. It is said that Greystone never allowed this shield to fall, even in the direst of battles, standing resolute against overwhelming odds to defend those in need.

name: Labraid Stone Idol
description: A small stone idol, believed to depict Labraid, the God of Secrets and Architect of the Tower. Such idols are common talisman carried by travelers, wanderers, and seekers from all factions within the Tower. It is believed that by honoring Labraid, the creator of the Tower, one may earn favor in their quest to find the Heart of Aether.

name: Lantern
description: Old oil lantern made iron, its glass cover clouded with soot. These lanterns were once carried by adventurers as they made their way through the Tower’s darkened halls. While most have long since gone out, the fact that they remain hints at the abruptness of their owners' fate. Some lanterns are found near resting places, while others lay beside the remains of those who never found their way out of the darkness.

name: Seraphine’s Wand of Infinite Knowledge
description: A delicate crystal wand, adorned with intricately carved glyphs along its length. This wand once belonged to Lady Seraphine, the Knight of Wisdom. It is said to have been crafted from the bones of a long-forgotten celestial being, and Seraphine imbued it with her vast arcane knowledge. The wand served as both a tool of her intellect and a channel for her unparalleled mastery of magic.

name: Tower Insignia Ring
description: A gold ring inscribed with unknown symbols. These rings were once given to members of a forgotten guild of adventurers dedicated to exploring the Tower. While the guild has long since dissolved, their rings are still found on the remains of adventurers who met their end within the Tower.

name: Frozen Hourglass of the Tower
description: This hourglass was once a tool for tracking time within the Tower, but the ever-shifting nature of the Tower’s reality caused its sand to halt, a victim of the temporal disturbances that plague the structure. Now, it stands as a relic of the Tower’s chaotic influence over time.

name: Ritual Daggers (Blunted)
description: Small dagger with dulled edges and point. Used in countless ceremonies, this ritual dagger is blunted over time from repeated use. Although no longer sharp, it was carried as mementos of the Cult’s most powerful rituals.

name: Purple Elixir of Labraid
description: A small, twisted glass vial filled with a viscous, deep purple liquid. This elixir is concocted in the shadowy rituals of the Cult of Labraid, believed to be infused with a drop of their god's dark essence. The exact purpose of the potion is shrouded in mystery, known only to the cult's highest acolytes.

name: Musket
description: A classic flintlock musket with a polished steel barrel and a sturdy wooden stock.  This musket is a common weapon found throughout the Tower, used by various adventurers and explorers who have ventured into its depths.

name: Sable’s Dagger of Relentless Resolve
description: A yellow, curved dagger that seems to pulse with an inner light. It vibrates slightly in the hand, urging its wielder to never falter.  Lady Sable, the Knight of Resolve, carried this dagger through the darkest reaches of the Tower. It represents her indomitable spirit.

name: Sword of the First Apostle
description: A menacing, green-hued sword with a grotesque handle, crafted from dark, twisted metal resembling sinuous, claw-like forms. This sword was once wielded by the First Apostle Ahriman, the leader of the Cult of Labraid. Said to have been forged in the depths of the Tower’s most twisted realms, it represents the Cult’s belief that power must be attained at all costs.

name: Tower Pebble
description: Small, smooth stone found on the floor of the Tower. It is unnaturally round and polished. These pebbles are considered a curiosity within the Tower. No one knows where they come from, but they appear to be naturally occurring. Some believe they are the remnants of a long-forgotten civilization that was ground to dust beneath the Tower’s weight. Others think they are seeds of the Tower itself, fragments of a living entity that continues to grow and evolve. Regardless of their origin, they are often kept as simple tokens by adventurers, reminders of the Tower’s quiet, ever-present nature.

name: Tower Crystal
description: Small, glowing crystals found throughout the Tower. They emit a soft, ethereal light and hum with magical energy. These crystals are believed to be fragments of the Tower itself, small pieces of Aether that have broken off from the walls over time. They are often used by adventurers as light sources or tokens of good luck. While their true origin remains a mystery, some believe that the crystals are connected to the magic that sustains the Tower and its ever-shifting structure.

name: The Veilbound Key
description: A small, intricately crafted key made from a material that seems to flicker between solid silver and translucent shadow. There are whispers of a door deep within the Tower that no one has ever seen, let alone opened. Said to have been crafted by the Tower’s enigmatic architect, Labraid, this key is rumored to unlock not just a physical gate, but a passage to something far greater—or far more dangerous. The key's origin is unknown, and no one can say for certain whether it is a relic of the Tower itself, or if it has somehow slipped through from another world entirely. The key thrums with an elusive resonance, poised to reveal its hidden truth when the time is right.

name: Bread
description: A warm, crusty loaf of bread with a golden-brown crust and a soft, airy interior. This loaf of fresh bread is a rare comfort in the Tower’s harsh environment. Baked with simple ingredients, it offers a moment of solace and nourishment to those who find it.

name: Cheese
description: A round, slightly aged cheese wheel with a hard, golden rind. This wheel of cheese is a rare find in the Tower, offering a touch of the familiar comforts of the outside world. For travelers and adventurers, it provides not only sustenance but a reminder of simpler times and the enduring nature of human comfort.

name: Small Cloak of the Shrouded Veil
description: A lightweight, dark red cloak made of a soft, almost ethereal fabric that seems to shift and ripple even in still air. This small cloak is a standard garb of the Shrouded Veil, known for their ability to move unnoticed through the world. Worn by low-ranking members of the faction, it offers both protection from prying eyes and a symbol of their affiliation. The cloak's fabric, said to be woven from threads collected in the spaces between reality, helps conceal its wearer within the shadows.

name: Votive candle
description: A small, hand-crafted candle, now partially melted. These candles were once carried by pilgrims who entered the Tower to pray for guidance, protection, or redemption. Many religious sects believed that lighting these candles would appease the Tower’s spirits or gods, granting them safe passage. Though their faith was often misplaced, the candles are still found throughout the Tower.

name: Cloak of High Seer Elandra
description: A majestic, floor-length cloak. The fabric flows gracefully, almost as if it were made of liquid shadow, and seems to shift and ripple with every movement, blending seamlessly into the surroundings. This cloak once belonged to High Seer Elandra, the revered leader of the Shrouded Veil. She was rumored to have glimpsed the future in her visions—one where the Heart of Aether fell into the wrong hands, leading to cataclysmic destruction. She believed it was her responsibility to prevent this at all costs.

name: Crown of the First King
description: An ancient crown that has withstood the wear of countless ages. This crown once adorned the head of the First King, the forgotten sovereign who ruled in the age before the Tower's rise. His reign, now shrouded in myth, was said to be marked by both great prosperity and terrible sacrifice. Legends speak of a pact made  that led to the creation of the Tower itself, locking the First King’s legacy within its walls.

name: Shadow-Worn Book
description: Thin book with worn leather covers, its pages yellowed and brittle. The writing within is faded and smudged, leaving many passages indecipherable. This book could be a personal journal or prayer book of lower-ranking Cult members, filled with invocations, dark thoughts, and visions of Labraid. Though many such books have fallen into disrepair, they provide a glimpse into the twisted minds of the Cult’s followers.

name: Tattered Prayer Scroll
description: Rolls of parchment covered in barely legible writing, often written in a strange, angular script. The edges are singed or torn, and the parchment itself is yellowed with age.  These prayer scrolls hold fervent pleas to Labraid, used in secret ceremonies or as personal prayers, seeking power and guidance to reach the elusive Last Door.

name: Engraved helm
description: Steel helmet, finely engraved with the symbols of the Order of the Four Knights. These helmets were custom-made for the elite knights of the Order of the Four Knights, each one bearing personalized engravings that reflected the knight’s personal victories or family crest.

name: Jester hat
description: A flamboyant, multicolored hat adorned with an array of bells that jingle softly with every movement. This hat is worn by Laurentius the Spy. Though he appears as a mere jester, Laurentius is sent by the Order of the Four Knights with the sworn duty to infiltrate the Cult of Labraid. His true allegiance remains a mystery.

name: Rusty key
description: A rusty key. The Tower is filled with locked doors and hidden chambers, and countless adventurers have spent their lives searching for the keys that might unlock them. These rusted keys are remnants of such efforts.

name: Celestial Compass
description: Intricately designed compass with celestial symbols engraved on its face. The needles point in all directions, seemingly at random, but they shine with a faint, otherworldly light. Unlike normal compasses, celestial compasses were designed to navigate the mystical currents of the Tower rather than physical locations. The Tower’s unpredictable nature often caused adventurers to become hopelessly lost, but these compasses were said to offer guidance through celestial alignment, even if their directions were difficult to understand. Despite their unpredictability, many still rely on them, hoping they might lead to forgotten passages or hidden treasures.

name: Silverhand Karis’ Blade of Fortune
description: A sleek and elegantly balanced rapier with a delicate handle shaped like a rose. This rapier once belonged to the infamous rogue “Silverhand” Karis, member of the Free Seekers, renowned for her extraordinary ability to escape from even the direst situations within the Tower. The blade embodies her belief that fortune favors the bold, and it is said that Karis’ quick wits and charm always led her to safety. Many seek this rapier, hoping to harness a fragment of Karis' elusive luck and skill.

name: Smartphone (Drained)
description: A sleek, rectangular device with a black surface, cold to the touch. Many believe this enigmatic slate hails from a distant realm, where its true function is understood. Its purpose remains a mystery, though some speculate it may be a tool for communication, guidance, or perhaps something far more advanced.

name: Torn page
description: A tattered, aged page of parchment with frayed edges and faded ink. This torn page originates from a far-off, enigmatic culture, containing writings that remain a mystery to most. Its elegant script and worn condition suggest it was once a piece of valuable knowledge or a sacred text, now lost to time and distance. The cryptic characters evoke curiosity and speculation, hinting at forgotten lore or ancient secrets from a land beyond known borders.

name: Training Dummy
description: Humanoid-shaped wooden dummies, worn and splintered from years of sword practice. These training dummies are used by the squires and knights of the Order of the Four Knights during their combat training. Placed in makeshift barracks or hidden sparring rooms within the Tower, the dummies served as tools for sharpening the swordsmanship and discipline of young warriors. Though now abandoned, they remain as silent witnesses to the rigorous training that forged the might of the Order of the Four Knights armies.

name: Stone amulet
description: Rough, unpolished stone amulet. These amulets are worn by members of the Shrouded Veil as protective charms during their journeys through the Tower. Carved during meditative rituals, the amulets are believed to ward off harmful energies and maintain the wearer’s inner balance. Though they are simple in design, each one carries the personal devotion of its creator.

name: Wine
description: Dust-covered glass bottle, containing old, probably sour, wine. Wine was a rare luxury in the Tower, often shared during brief moments of respite. Some bottles were carefully stashed away by explorers or smugglers for celebrations or ceremonies, though much of it has since spoiled.

name: Night of Veils Candies
description: A small, festive box filled with an assortment of colorful treats. Some say that hidden among the sweets are whispers of long-forgotten secrets, only revealed to those daring enough to indulge. Perfect for a night of tricks, treats, and mystery within the Tower.

name: Batwing Scythe
description: This menacing scythe features a dark blade shaped like a bat’s wings, forged from a rare, shadowy metal. It is said to be wielded by a mysterious knight who emerges from the depths of the Tower only once a year, on The Night of Veils. Known as the Warden Of Shadows this knight guards the Tower's darkest secrets and vanishes with the dawn. Legends whisper that anyone who crosses paths with him will be haunted by visions of the Tower's hidden realms.
